summary: Build GODMODE (Beta): a mobile application that ingests biometric, environmental, and social/context signals to recommend micro-actions that increase the statistical likelihood of a user-specified outcome, including features like Event Drift, Inject Uncertainty, Reality Pressure (probability debt), and collective effects (Timeline Fracture).
architectural_notes: Position the system as behavior/decision guidance (statistical nudging) rather than literal reality manipulation.
App architecture requires multi-source real-time data ingestion (wearables/biometrics, ambient/environmental, social/sentiment, mobility/crowd proxies) feeding a recommendation engine.
Include an uncertainty/risk model to support Event Drift probabilities, Inject Uncertainty mode, and Probability Debt/Reality Pressure trade-offs.
Support both individual-level guidance sessions and aggregated city-level analytics for Timeline Fracture effects.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- App logo mark: abstract ‘probability distortion’ sigil, high-contrast, minimal (godmode-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide hero background: dark cinematic gradient with subtle noise + faint grid/wave interference pattern (godmode-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Set of 6 monochrome UI icons (slider, spark/uncertainty, warning/debt, map/city, compass/route, clock/timing) (godmode-icons-set.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create the GODMODE (Beta) app shell with a coherent, distinctive visual theme applied consistently across all screens (colors, typography, spacing, components), avoiding a blue/purple default palette, and using English for all user-facing text.
Add Internet Identity sign-in/out and show the authenticated user state in the UI (signed out vs signed in), gating creation/viewing of sessions behind authentication.

Implement the core “Outcome Session” flow: user enters a desired outcome (free text), selects optional parameters (time horizon, risk tolerance), and starts a session that generates and displays a list of recommended micro-adjustments.

Add a “Context Scan” screen/module that collects user-provided proxy signals (since real sensor and camera integrations are not available in this template): stress level, mood, social energy, weather (manual), crowd density (manual), and a free-form notes field; attach the captured context snapshot to the active session.

Create the “Event Drift” dashboard for a session, showing a live-style probability breakdown/trajectory (e.g., average week %, unusual %, high-impact %, life-altering %) and a single primary slider/control to represent the current trajectory state; values must be generated from session/context and update when the user regenerates or changes settings.

Add “Reality Pressure / Probability Debt” tracking per user: each time a user regenerates guidance or repeatedly pushes toward low-probability/high-impact outcomes (based on the generated Event Drift distribution and Inject Uncertainty), increase a Probability Debt score; show warnings and simple trade-off indicators (e.g., career vs burnout/relationship strain) derived from debt and context.

Implement a “Timeline Fracture” prototype: when users toggle Inject Uncertainty, record an aggregate count by a user-provided ‘city/region’ field; show a public (non-identifying) dashboard of current aggregate uncertainty activation per city/region and a generated ‘collective effect’ readout (traffic anomalies/stock volatility/social collisions/viral moments/unplanned gatherings).

Add clear in-app disclosure text explaining that GODMODE is a speculative/prototype experience that provides behavioral prompts and probabilistic framing, does not guarantee outcomes, and uses user-entered proxy context (no real biometric/camera/social scraping in this build).

Frontend navigation: provide screens for (1) Home/Landing, (2) New Session, (3) Session Detail (recommendations + Event Drift), (4) Context Scan, (5) Timeline Fracture dashboard, and (6) Settings/About (city/region + disclosure).

new_feature_requests.summary: Outcome input + goal session flow (user enters desired outcome and starts a guidance session)
Context scanning/ingestion layer for signals (biometrics, environment, social/sentiment, movement/heatmap proxies)
Recommendation engine to generate micro-adjustments (timing, route, clothing cue, location, duration) to increase odds
Event Drift dashboard showing probability slider/trajectory for near-term outcomes
"Inject Uncertainty" toggle to increase randomness/risk exposure in recommendations
Reality Pressure / Probability Debt warnings with trade-off visualization (e.g., career vs burnout/relationship strain)
Timeline Fracture: detect/predict collective effects when many users toggle Inject Uncertainty in a city/region
Camera-based micro-expression detection and conversation tone analysis modules (where supported/allowed)

Implement the “Recommendation Engine” as a deterministic + stochastic generator that uses (a) the outcome text, (b) context snapshot, and (c) an “Inject Uncertainty” setting to produce micro-adjustments; store the generated recommendations and an explanation string for each recommendation in the session.

Implement basic data model + persistence for: user profile (city/region, preferences), sessions (outcome, parameters, context snapshots, recommendations, Event Drift probabilities), and user Probability Debt, all stored in the single Motoko actor.
